Using PrismJs with AngularJs

Oct 18, 2013

If you need to display code snippets in an AngularJs application I got you covered.

In a project I’m working on I need to display code snippets. I found PrismJs library, which is lightweight and cover a lot of languages. The application is based on AngularJs, and code snippets are displayed after having been read from an API and PrimsJs is run before code is injected in the template, when used as the documentation said. The problem can be tackled down with the creation of a directive. Here is the code :

 1 angular.module('Prism', []).
 2     directive('prism', [function() {
 3         return {
 4             restrict: 'A',
 5             link: function ($scope, element, attrs) {
 6                 element.ready(function() {
 7                     Prism.highlightElement(element[0]);
 8                 });
 9             }
10         } 
11     }]
12 );

For each HTML element marked with the prism attribute we wait that the inner DOM is fully loaded, using the ready function, and then trigger Prism highlighting on it.

1 <pre>
2     <code class="language-markup" prim>
3     <a href="#">This a link</a>
4     </code>
5 </pre>

Here is the Gist !
